meanings.definition: Either of the two external openings of the nasal cavity in vertebrates that admit air to the lungs and smells to the olfactory nerves.
meanings.sent1: The nostril on the left side of my nose was blocked.
meanings.sent2: She could smell the flowers through her nostril.
meanings.sent3: The nostril of the dragon was so big, it could inhale a whole village!
meanings.sent4: His keen sense of smell was like having a nostril for trouble.
meanings.sent5: The nostril of the elephant was large enough to fit a basketball.
